## Filtering `NA`s

The `penguins` data set contains some missing values that can complicate things. How many `bill_len`

```{r}
is.na(penguins$bill_len)
sum(is.na(penguins$bill_len))
mean(is.na(penguins$bill_len))
```

About 0.6% are missing. Two Total. Let's filter the set to just keep these. The obvious thing does not work

```{r}
penguins %>%
  filter(bill_len == NA) # no matches 
```

```{r}
penguins %>%
  filter(is.na(bill_len))
```
We keep non-missing values like so:
```{r}
penguins %>%
  filter(!is.na(bill_len))
```
